titleproper.value: Guide to the Alan Snitow and Deborah Kaufman Papers <num>TAM 720</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-07-16T16:36:12</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Alan Snitow and Deborah Kaufman Papers

extent.value: in 5 record cartons, 3 manuscript boxes, and 1 half manuscript box

abstract.value: The Alan Snitow and Deborah Kaufman Papers contain research materials and personal files related to the work of journalists and filmmakers Alan Snitow and Deborah Kaufman. Half of the collection documents Snitow and Kaufman's film company Snitow-Kaufman Productions, which includes research and promotional materials related to their films. Two boxes include FBI files used as research for the documentary <emph render="italic">Between Two Worlds</emph>. Papers related to their other documentaries feature interviews, film transcripts, and press materials for the films <emph render="italic">Blacks and Jews</emph>, <emph render="italic">Thirst</emph>, <emph render="italic">Drones in My Backyard</emph>, <emph render="italic">Between Two Worlds</emph>, <emph render="italic">Secrets of Silicon Valley</emph>, <emph render="italic">Company Town</emph>, and <emph render="italic">Offshoring</emph>. The collection also contains two boxes of Alan Snitow's files documenting his work at KPFA-Pacifica Radio, as well as diaries and interview notes from a 1989 trip to the Soviet Union.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Alan Snitow and Deborah Kaufman Papers; TAM 720; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Alan Snitow and Deborah Kaufman in March 2017. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2017.019 and 2017.072.

Alan Snitow is a journalist who worked for 12 years as a producer at KTVU-TV News, the Bay Area Fox new station, and as News Director and reporter at the Bay Area's Pacifica Radio station, KPFA-FM in the 1970s and 1980s.

Other materials in the collection include diaries, interviews, and tape logs from a trip Snitow took to the Soviet Union in 1989. Snitow used some of his research from this trip in his reporting at KPFA, but his diaries also document his personal experiences during his travels.
